ants

Class AntGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • basis.Game
      • ants.AntGame

  • public class AntGame
extends Game
    This class represents an ant game being played. It overloads the generic Game class to implement a game of ants similar to ants.AIChallenge. General game rules can be found on the ants.AIChalllenge web site.
    Author:
    JMN
    See Also:
    http://ants.aichallenge.org/specification.php

    • Field Detail

      • LOGGER

        private static final org.slf4j.Logger LOGGER

      • mapTemplate

        private AntMapTemplate mapTemplate
        The static map template used to initialize the game objects of the game map. It represents the generic layout of the game map.

      • map

        private AntGameMap map
        The dynamic map storing all the game objects of the game. It represents the current state of the game.

      • ants

        private java.util.ArrayList<Ant> ants
        The list of ants present on the map.

        The mask that simulates fog war for vision.

        The class that holds replay data for the ant game.

        private java.util.Date startDate
        The game starting date.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AntGame

        public AntGame(java.util.ArrayList<Bot> bots,
               int maxRound,
               int responseTime,
               int loadTime,
               AntMapTemplate mapTemplate,
               int foodRespawnDelay,
               float viewRadius2,
               float attackRadius2)
        Creates a new ant game from a map template and a list of bots playing in this game. Fake bots are created to play with the other bots if there is not enough bots.
        Parameters:
        bots - the list of bots that are gonna play in this game.
        maxRound - the maximum number of round in this game.
        responseTime - the maximum response time for a bot in ms.
        loadTime - the time allowed to the bots to init their AI in ms.
        mapTemplate - the template used to initialize the game map.
        foodRespawnDelay - the number of turns between 2 food spawns.
        viewRadius2 - the square of the view radius of an ant.
        attackRadius2 - the square of the attack radius of an ant.

      • addAnt

        Adds an ant to the game.

        ant - the ant to add to the ants lists.

      • removeAnt

        protected void removeAnt(Ant ant,
                         java.util.Iterator<Ant> antIt)
        Removes an ant from the game, while being safe used in a loop.
        Parameters:
        ant - the ant to remove from the ants lists.
        antIt - the iterator used in the loop (used for safe removal, must be an iterator on the "ants" array).

      • removeHill

        protected void removeHill(AntHill hill,
                          java.util.Iterator<AntHill> hillIt)
        Removes a will from the game, while being safe used in a loop.
        Parameters:
        hill - the hill to remove from the hills lists.
        hillIt - the iterator used in the loop (have to be from botInfo.getHillIterator()).

      • isRankStabilized

        private boolean isRankStabilized()
        Returns whether the rank is stabilized (i.e. no player with at least one remaining hill can beat the score of any of his opponents).
        Returns:
        true if the rank is stabilized, false otherwise.

      • isFinished

        public boolean isFinished()
        Returns whether the ant game is finished. An ant game is finished when: "lone survivor", "rank stabilized", or "turn limit reached".
        Overrides:
        isFinished in class Game
        Returns:
        true if the game is finished, false otherwise.

      • update

        public void update()
        Updates the game state of an ant game. Phases: attack, raze hills, spawn ants, gather food, spawn food.
        Specified by:
        update in class Game

        Parameters:

        reason - a message explaining why the bot was muted.
